page.title: 15SPECIAL HOUSING FOR O.A.P.s
page.content: In the{Springpark}area of{Thurso there are 34 specially designed houses for retired people. There are 40 residents aged from 60 to 89 years, and though most of them are house bound the oldest gentleman of 89 still drives a car. Mrs. Carter, the warden, is on call 24 hours a day but has help from a relief warden 2 days a week. At about 9a.m. she visits all the houses to check that everyone is alright. If they wish to alert the warden the tenants have a bell in each house which rings in the wardens home. There is a box on the wall with each house number in it and the number of the house lights up when the bell starts ringing. In case of emergency the warden has a key for every house. The residents are very happy but would like a common room to meet in.
